nodes.description: 在巴基斯坦拉合尔市的一个儿童公园发生了一起爆炸袭击，造成至少70人死亡，250多人受伤，大部分受害者是妇女和儿童。
nodes.support_text: Thousands lined up to donate blood at hospitals in Pakistan's second largest city Lahore after a bombing at a popular children's park in the Iqbal Town neighborhood. At least 70 people were killed and over 250 injured at Gulshan-i-Iqbal Park. Most of the victims of the bombing are women and children.

nodes.description: 当地出租车服务Careem提供免费交通服务，方便人们前往医院献血。
nodes.support_text: Careem, a local on-demand taxi service, are offering free transport to the hospital for anyone willing to donate blood.

nodes.description: 七小时后，活动家Jibran Nasir在推特上表示，拉合尔医院的献血者仍然很多，这让人看到了希望。
nodes.support_text: Seven hours after the bombing, Pakistani activist Jibran Nasir, who has over 70,000 Facebook followers and ran as an independent candidate in Pakistan's 2013 elections, tweeted: 3:00am Lahore Hospitals still crowded with blood donors. This is what makes us Pakistan. This is what gives us hope, keeps us going #YouLost

edges.support_text: Following the attack, scores of citizens began coordinating efforts to donate blood and provide support to the families of the victims.

Seven hours after the bombing, Pakistani activist Jibran Nasir, who has over 70,000 Facebook followers and ran as an independent candidate in Pakistan's 2013 elections, tweeted: 3:00am Lahore Hospitals still crowded with blood donors. This is what makes us Pakistan. This is what gives us hope, keeps us going #YouLost
